title: How to Do a Messy Updo

steps.title: Put your hair in a high ponytail.
steps.content: Put your hair in a high ponytail. Position it at the top of your head, either right up top or a few inches toward the back. There's no need to make it neat and tight; let the ponytail be a little loose. It's fine if a few strands fall out on the sides and back.

steps.title: Tease your ponytail.
steps.content: Tease your ponytail. Hold it straight up and insert a comb near the tips. Backcomb your hair toward the roots to tease it and add volume and texture. Continue until your entire ponytail has been teased. It should now look messy and tousled. If you'd like, you could instead curl your hair before putting it up in a ponytail. The curly effect will make your hair look tousled, but still neat enough to wear to a nice evening event. For this look, there's no need to tease or curl the hair that's not in your ponytail.

steps.title: Separate your ponytail into two sections.
steps.content: Separate your ponytail into two sections. Just divide it into two equal sections, and hold them apart.

steps.title: Wrap the first section around the base of your ponytail.
steps.content: Wrap the first section around the base of your ponytail. Twist it and wind it around the hairband, holding it in place against your head. Use a few bobby pins to secure it there.

steps.title: Wrap the second section around the base of your ponytail.
steps.content: Wrap the second section around the base of your ponytail. Do the same thing, twisting it and winding it around the other portion of your headband. Pin it in place against your head. Take a look in the mirror: your hairband should no longer be visible.

steps.title: Pull out a few strands and loosen it up.
steps.content: Pull out a few strands and loosen it up. Here's the part where things get messy. Grab the bun and move it in a circular motion to loosen it a bit. Use your fingers to pull out a few strands so it looks a little messier. Finally, pull out a few strands of hair from the area around your temples to frame your face and complete the look.

steps.title: Use medium-hold hairspray.
steps.content: Use medium-hold hairspray. This will let your hair move while also keep your updo from falling out. Your look is now complete.

steps.title: Part your hair on one side.
steps.content: Part your hair on one side. This pretty low bun looks great with a side part. If you're doing your hair for a formal evening event, a deeper part (further to the side) looks elegant. Run the tip of a comb along your part to make it straight. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tease or curl your hair.
steps.content: Tease or curl your hair. This step is optional if you're not in the mood to go all out. However, if you tease or curl your hair, it will take your messy low bun up a few notches. Lift the top layer of your hair and backcomb it toward the roots to add volume and texture. Alternately, use a curling iron to curl the top layer of your hair so it won't be completely smooth. Of course, if your hair is naturally curly and voluminous, this step is completely unnecessary; your bun will look beautifully messy on its own.

steps.title: Gather your hair into a low ponytail.
steps.content: Gather your hair into a low ponytail. Position it at the nape of your neck or slightly higher up, according to your preference. You could even position it on the side, just under one of your ears. For now, don't make a tight ponytail; just wrap the ponytail around your hair one time.

steps.title: Use your hairband to create a looped bun.
steps.content: Use your hairband to create a looped bun. Twist the hairband and pull it over your ponytail, but this time don't pull the hair all the way through. Stop pulling before your ends are all the way through the hairband. Leave several inches of the ends of your hair sticking out. You should now have a simple looped bun. If the ponytail seems loose, use a second ponytail to ensure the looped bun stays securely in place. While the look should be messy, you don't want it to be so loose it falls out.

steps.title: Gently lift the top and sides of your hair.
steps.content: Gently lift the top and sides of your hair. You want to add some volume to the look by pulling up the top and sides of your hair so it doesn't lie flat against your head. this will help the look go from "sleek" to "messy." Check out your hair in the mirror, and pull out a few strands from around your temples, too.

steps.title: Wrap the ends of your hair around the hairband.
steps.content: Wrap the ends of your hair around the hairband. Take the ends that are still sticking out of your bun and wrap them around the hairband to hide it from view. Use bobby pins to secure the hair in place.

steps.title: Use medium-hold hairspray to finish the look.
steps.content: Use medium-hold hairspray to finish the look. This will let your hair move while also keeping it from falling out.

steps.title: Decide where to part your hair.
steps.content: Decide where to part your hair. This look can be done with either a side part or a middle part. Comb out your hair, then run the tip of your comb along the part to make sure it's straight. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Separate the sides of your hair from the back.
steps.content: Separate the sides of your hair from the back. The braids will run from your temples to the back of your hair when this look is complete, so for now you want to gather hair from your temple area and drape it over your shoulders to keep it separate from the back. The bigger the sections of hair, the bigger your braids will be. If you want small braids, just separate out 1 ‚ÅÑ 2 inch (1.3 cm) sections of hair from either side. For thicker braids, the sections should be 1 to 2 inches wide.

steps.title: Gather the back of your hair into a tight ponytail.
steps.content: Gather the back of your hair into a tight ponytail. Leave the side sections out, and create a ponytail with the back of your hair. Position it at the nape of your neck or a few inches higher according to your preference.

steps.title: Twist your ponytail around the hairband to form a bun.
steps.content: Twist your ponytail around the hairband to form a bun. Twist it and lay it in a coil around your hairband to make a pretty ballerina-style bun, then pin the ends in place with several bobby pins. You want the bun to be quite secure, so don't skimp on the bobby pins.

steps.title: Braid the right section of hair.
steps.content: Braid the right section of hair. Start near your temple and make a braid all the way to the ends. The braid can be as tight or as loose as you want.

steps.title: Wrap the end of the braid around the base of the bun.
steps.content: Wrap the end of the braid around the base of the bun. It should lay against the side of your head and pass under the tip of your ear before the end reaches the bun. Wrap the end around the base of the bun (several times, if necessary) and use a bobby pin to secure it in place.

steps.title: Braid the left section of hair.
steps.content: Braid the left section of hair. Start near your temple and make a braid all the way to the ends. The braid can be as tight or as loose as you want.

steps.title: Wrap the end of the braid around the base of the bun.
steps.content: Wrap the end of the braid around the base of the bun. Do this just the same way as the other side. The braid should lay against the side of your head and pass under the tip of your ear before the end reaches the bun. Wrap the end around the base of the bun (several times, if necessary) and use a bobby pin to secure it in place.

steps.title: Loosen the look to make it messy.
steps.content: Loosen the look to make it messy. Pull out a few strands of hair here and there to create a more tousled appearance. Focus on the area around your face, since it's pretty to have a few face-framing strands hanging down around the braids.

steps.title: Finish with medium-hold hairspray.
steps.content: Finish with medium-hold hairspray. This will help your hair stay messy-looking while holding everything in place and keeping the braids from coming loose.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
